sen.j: 多 忠龍（おお の ただたつ、元治2年3月15日 (旧暦)（1865年4月10日） - 昭和19年（1944年）12月22日）は、雅楽家、帝国芸術院会員。
sen.e: O no Tadatatsu (April 10, 1865 - December 22, 1944) was gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music) and the member of Imperial Art Academy.
O no Tadatatsu (April 10, 1865 - December 22, 1944) was gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music) and the member of Imperial Art Academy.
O no Tadatatsu (April 10, 1865 - December 22, 1944) was gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music) and the member of Imperial Art Academy.

sen.j: 古代以来の宮廷雅楽家の家に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in the gagakuka family of Imperial court since ancient times.
He was born in the gagakuka family of Imperial court since ancient times.
He was born in the gagakuka family of Imperial court since ancient times.

sen.j: 父は右近衛将曹・多忠廉（1847－1916）。
sen.e: His father was O no Tadakiyo, Ukone no shoso (Secretary of Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) (1847 - 1916).
His father was O no Tadakiyo, Ukone no shoso (Secretary of Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) (1847 - 1916).
His father was O no Tadakiyo, Ukone no shoso (Secretary of Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) (1847 - 1916).
He was originally from Kyoto Prefecture.
He was originally from Kyoto Prefecture.
He was originally from Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 1872年宮内省一等出仕、1888年楽手伶人。
sen.e: He became the first grade Shusshi (supernumerary government official) of the Imperial Household Ministry in 1872 and the Gagaku musician in 1888.
He became the first grade Shusshi (supernumerary government official) of the Imperial Household Ministry in 1872 and the Gagaku musician in 1888.
He became the first grade Shusshi (supernumerary government official) of the Imperial Household Ministry in 1872 and the Gagaku musician in 1888.

sen.j: 1902年雅楽師ならびに楽師（クラリネット演奏）。
sen.e: He became gagakushi (court musician) and gakushi (musician) (clarinet player) in 1902.
He became gagakushi (court musician) and gakushi (musician) (clarinet player) in 1902.
He became gagakushi (court musician) and gakushi (musician) (clarinet player) in 1902.
He became the Master of Music Department of the Imperial Household Ministry.
He became the Master of Music Department of the Imperial Household Ministry.
He became the Master of Music Department of the Imperial Household Ministry.
He resigned in 1924.

He resigned in 1924.
He became the member of Imperial Art Academy in 1937.
He became the member of Imperial Art Academy in 1937.

His book "Gagaku" was published in 1942.
